page.title: 04HOLYWELL
page.content: Holywell is a scattered settlement in a picturesque setting. The parkland of Holywell Hall (itself just outside our block), grazed by sheep and Canada geese, slopes down to a group of three small lakes. Two, within the grounds of the Hall, are ornamental; the third is an old mill pond overgrown with willows and alders. An attractively situated stone house overlooks the middle lake. Downstream is a stone-built farmhouse, recently much restored, with several new farm buildings. A hilltop farm is now a private house, though its buildings are still used. Two isolated stone cottages were converted into one house about eight years ago after being used as farm buildings. The rough track to another isolated house (originally kennels) was recently resurfaced with crushed stone.
